title: Several Inquisitions about the Alpha
body:
Several questions and if a Rioter could respond it would be much appreciated :D

--Does having this new client make it easier to implement new maps or game modes?

--Currently, the new client is using a little bit more CPU and memory for my pc than the old client.  Is this a problem with my pc or the client? (I always use low graphics and tend to do nothing else but LoL while playing)

--How exactly does the new client make things easier to create? (e.g. new features)

--The client seems to be slower than the legacy client when it comes to loading things. Is there a plan to fix the loading times?

--Are there plans to put spectating back into the client??

--When you get kicked off the internet or something happens that causes the new client to close, it takes almost twice to three times longer to get back into the game. Are there plans to fix that so it's like the legacy client where we can jump back in?

Thank you!! :D

replies.body:
- The new client doesn't have an impact on the development of new maps and game modes. It is a completely different tech stack (software project). Adding new features to the client will be way easier though. Say a new map or game mode is created, once ready, making it available to the players in the new client will be very easy.

- The graphic settings from the client and the game are completely independent. It is true that the alpha is not as optimized as it could be and we are currently working on improving its performance. As we get closer to the beta and deprecation of the legacy client, the speed and memory consumption should improve noticeably.

- It is easier to add new features to the new client because:
 - We are using web technologies and open standards, it allows us to leverage more open source technologies.
 - We have created a plugins architecture that allow us to have teams work independently in new features without blocking or being blocked in any way by other teams. Work can happen in parallel. This might not sound like a novel idea, but it is within the web development scene.
 - If you are a technical person, this blog post can give you more insight: https://engineering.riotgames.com/news/architecture-league-client-update

-  Yes, there is a plan to decrease loading times and to improve performance in general as we move closer to AIR deprecation.

- I don't know what is the plan for spectating mode. I think it will come back at some point, but that is my personal guess. I do not work with that team and I can't say for sure.

- We are aware of the many problems that are caused by losing the connection to the Internet. We fixed a couple of them, but then discovered that the problem is more systemic. We are  currently designing a more holistic solution that should fix all the glitches that we've seen. This kind of problem is exactly the type of thing that we want to catch during an alpha. We have to rethink how we handle wonky connections.

Keep submitting your questions,
thanks for testing the alpha!

Thank you very much for the information!! I like to have knowledge of how things are developed and how we as a community can help :D

I'm also not a Rito employee, but I too have an answer for you:
The new client will have all the features of the current client (spectating etc.).

Edit: I think you meant "Inquiries" and not "Inquisitions"
